title: Tough lates market on the cards as anxieties increase around the Med
text:
Tough lates market on the cards as anxieties increase around the Med 8 July 2015 Save 
Agents have warned the trade to expect a tough lates market amid concerns over certain short-haul destinations and reduced capacities. 
Toucan Travel general manager Jo Matley said geopolitical incidents across the Mediterranean had limited the number of traditional summer-sun destinations that customers feel comfortable travelling to. 
She said problems had been compounded by airlines increasing prices to popular destinations, meaning fewer bargains were on offer in the market. 
Matley said: “People are not wanting to do Turkey, Tunisia or Egypt and they’re also having reservations about going to Greece. 
“They’re still going to be looking for the low-cost offers in the places that predominantly are not low cost.” 
She added that destinations proving popular included Menorca, Majorca and Portugal, but warned: “Every time people look at the flight options, I’m sure the airlines take account of that and say we can get the prices up there. Consumers are only going to find those [deals] in destinations that people are unsure about - like Turkey and Greece. 
“We’re still encouraging Turkey, Greece and Egypt. It’ll be a battle before we can send people back to Tunisia, but it will happen.” 
Others suggested the market had altered so much that the lates market now barely existed. 
John Sullivan, head of commercial and marketing at The Advantage Travel Partnership, said: “In May and June… there was some really low pricing out there, but it was for the shoulder season. As we head into the peaks season, I don’t think the situation is any different to last year or the year before.” 
He said the consortium’s members had been rebooking customers due to holiday in Tunisia to Bulgaria instead, as it has the best price parity. 
Chris Bailey, owner of Baileys Travel in Northamptonshire, said the lates market was no longer able to operate in the usual way.“Any travel agent who is reliant on late bookings wants their head read and they want to move their business model to something more sustainable,” he said.
